<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 1"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Unconventional Weaponry](/Feats.aspx?ID=72) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Human" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=90" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 57 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

</column>

---

You've familiarized yourself with a particular weapon, potentially from another ancestry or culture. Choose an uncommon simple or martial weapon with a trait corresponding to an ancestry (such as [dwarf](/Traits.aspx?ID=54), [goblin](/Traits.aspx?ID=81), or [orc](/Traits.aspx?ID=124)) or that is common in another culture. You gain access to that weapon, and for the purpose of determining your proficiency, that weapon is a simple weapon.

 If you are trained in all martial weapons, you can choose an uncommon advanced weapon with such a trait. You gain access to that weapon, and for the purpose of determining your proficiency, that weapon is a martial weapon.

<title level="2">Unconventional Weaponry leads to...</title>
[Unconventional Expertise](/Feats.aspx?ID=78)
